title: Start of Ron DeSantis presidential campaign melts down in Twitter problems
description: A much-anticipated Twitter event in which Florida Gov.

title: Google searches questioning sexuality and gender up 1,300% since 2004, analysis shows
description: Google searches by users for phrases questioning their own sexuality and gender identity — including “Am I gay” and “Am I lesbian” — have increased by 1,300% since 2004, according to a new analysis.

title: Jan. 6 rioter who put his feet on desk in Pelosi office sentenced to 4.5 years in prison
description: Richard "Bigo" Barnett, the Arkansas man who was photographed on Jan. 6 with his feet on a desk in Nancy Pelosi's office, was sentenced to 45 months in prison.

title: FBI releases its files on Queen Elizabeth II, revealing fears of ‘everpresent’ IRA threats
description: Queen Elizabeth II's FBI files, released in response to a FOIA request, shows clearly that the FBI was cognizant of the threat posed by the Irish Republican Army.

title: Jack Dorsey shares Robert F. Kennedy Jr. video echoing conspiracy theories
description: Jack Dorsey, the head of Block Inc and co-founder of Twitter, posted two videos in the past week featuring presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

title: White House accuses congressional Republicans of holding Americans ‘hostage’ in debate
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has repeatedly warned that without an increase to the debt ceiling, the United States could run out of cash to pay the bills as soon as June 1.

title: Target quietly moves Pride merchandise in some stores as conservative activists declare victory
description: Target pulled part of its Pride month collection after receiving "threats impacting our team members’ sense of safety and wellbeing."

title: Tina Turner, trailblazing 'Queen of Rock 'n' Roll' who dazzled audiences worldwide, dies at 83
description: Tina Turner, the exuberant, heel-stomping, wild-haired rock goddess, has died.

title: Ron DeSantis officially jumps into the 2024 race
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis announced via Twitter he is running for president in the 2024 election as a GOP candidate, taking on Joe Biden and Donald Trump.

title: Driver of U-Haul that rammed White House gate is not a U.S. citizen, prosecutors say
description: WASHINGTON — The man accused of ramming a U-Haul truck into barriers near the White House earlier this week isn't a U.S. citizen or a lawful, permanent resident, prosecutors said Wednesday.

title: Rapper Fetty Wap sentenced to 6 years in prison for drug trafficking scheme
description: Rapper Fetty Wap was sentenced to six years in prison Wednesday for his role in a large-scale drug trafficking scheme that saw narcotics shipped from the West Coast and sold in New Jersey and Long Island.

title: House Democratic angst grows as Biden's debt limit negotiations with GOP drag on
description: House Democratic anxieties are flaring over President Joe Biden's debt ceiling negotiations with Republican Speaker Kevin McCarthy to avert a U.S. default.

title: America’s nuclear secrets are vulnerable to fraudsters and spies, watchdog report says
description: A new watchdog report says the federal agency that keeps the nation’s nuclear secrets has failed to establish an “insider threat” program to guard against fraudsters, leakers and spies in its midst.

title: Alex Murdaugh indicted on financial fraud charges related to housekeeper's death
description: A federal grand jury indicted convicted murderer and former South Carolina lawyer Alex Murdaugh on 22 financial fraud-related charges, including that he cheated his late housekeeper's estate and insurance carriers out of nearly $3.5 million, prosecutors said Wednesday.

title: Brain and spine implants enabled a paralyzed man to climb stairs and walk on rough terrain, study shows
description: Video shows how a system of implants in a paralyzed patient's brain and spinal cord can pair with external devices to translate his thoughts into movement.

title: States hit with unusually wet winters now brace for an unpredictable wildfire season
description: As wildfire season approaches, here’s what experts are saying about how natural forces like climate change and dense snowfalls earlier this year may affect it.

title: Debt limit negotiations hit 'speed bump,' Democratic official says
description: Negotiations over how to address the debt limit to avoid a catastrophic default have hit a "speed bump," a Democratic official familiar with the talks.

title: Chief justice calls building fence around Supreme Court 'hardest decision' of his tenure
description: Chief Justice John Roberts said his toughest call in the job was to put up a fence around the building after the leak of the ruling that overturned abortion rights.

title: DeSantis to announce presidential bid in Twitter talk with Elon Musk
description: After months of speculation, Florida’s Gov. Ron DeSantis is set to officially announce his White House bid in a Twitter Spaces chat with Elon Musk. NBC’s Dasha Burns reports for TODAY.

title: Trump lawyers seek meeting with AG  Garland
description: Lawyers for Donald Trump on Tuesday asked for a meeting with Attorney General Merrick Garland as a Justice Department investigation into the former president’s handling of classified documents shows signs of winding down.
